info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 4:21PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN MERCER... NORTHEASTERN LAWRENCE...NORTHERN BUTLER...CENTRAL ARMSTRONG AND SOUTHERN CLARION COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM EDT... At 421 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Slippery Rock, or 8 miles southwest of Grove City, moving east at 75 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Grove City, Rimersburg, Shanor-Northvue, Slippery Rock, New Bethlehem, Chicora, East Brady, Harrisville, Parker, Plain Grove Township, Sligo, and Bruin. This includes Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 100 and 113. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
